author: Staff Reporter
text:
The incidence of suicides by students is on the rise and the Tamil Nadu government along the Education department should work out means to stop students from taking hasty decisions, like ending their lives, Minister of State for Road Transport and Highways Pon Radhakrishnan said on Thursday.

Speaking to reporters here, he said a fair trial into the death of the three girls of the SVS College of Naturopathy in Villupuram should be held and those found guilty should be punished.

Earlier, he inspected the venue for the public meeting (at the CODISSIA Ground) where Prime Minister Narendra Modi would be speaking on February 2.

On the Prime Minister’s visit to the city, he said it would bring about a change in the political scenario in Tamil Nadu. “It will mark the beginning of Bharatiya Janata Party’s (BJP) election campaign,” he said. The Union Minister expressed confidence that many more parties would join the BJP before the Assembly elections in Tamil Nadu.
title: Govt. should arrange counselling for students: BJP
